dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) Seems To Use Debt Rather Sparingly
News Content: David Iben put it well when he said, 'Volatility is not a risk we care about. What we care about is avoiding the permanent loss of capital.' When we think about how risky a company is, we always like to look at its use of debt, since debt overload can lead to ruin. Importantly, Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) does carry debt. But the real question is whether this debt is making the company risky.

Why Does Debt Bring Risk?

Debt and other liabilities become risky for a business when it cannot easily fulfill those obligations, either with free cash flow or by raising capital at an attractive price. Ultimately, if the company can't fulfill its legal obligations to repay debt, shareholders could walk away with nothing. However, a more usual (but still expensive) situation is where a company must dilute shareholders at a cheap share price simply to get debt under control. Of course, the upside of debt is that it often represents cheap capital, especially when it replaces dilution in a company with the ability to reinvest at high rates of return. The first thing to do when considering how much debt a business uses is to look at its cash and debt together.

Check out our latest analysis for Apple

What Is Apple's Net Debt?

You can click the graphic below for the historical numbers, but it shows that Apple had US$106.6b of debt in September 2024, down from US$111.1b, one year before. However, because it has a cash reserve of US$65.2b, its net debt is less, at about US$41.5b.NasdaqGS:AAPL Debt to Equity History January 15th 2025

A Look At Apple's Liabilities

According to the last reported balance sheet, Apple had liabilities of US$176.4b due within 12 months, and liabilities of US$131.6b due beyond 12 months. Offsetting this, it had US$65.2b in cash and US$66.2b in receivables that were due within 12 months. So its liabilities outweigh the sum of its cash and (near-term) receivables by US$176.6b.

Of course, Apple has a titanic market capitalization of US$3.51t, so these liabilities are probably manageable. However, we do think it is worth keeping an eye on its balance sheet strength, as it may change over time. Carrying virtually no net debt, Apple has a very light debt load indeed.

We use two main ratios to inform us about debt levels relative to earnings. The first is net debt divided by earnings before interest, tax, depreciation, and amortization (EBITDA), while the second is how many times its earnings before interest and tax (EBIT) covers its interest expense (or its interest cover, for short). Thus we consider debt relative to earnings both with and without depreciation and amortization expenses.

Story Continues

Apple has a low net debt to EBITDA ratio of only 0.31. And its EBIT covers its interest expense a whopping 673 times over. So we're pretty relaxed about its super-conservative use of debt. The good news is that Apple has increased its EBIT by 7.8% over twelve months, which should ease any concerns about debt repayment. When analysing debt levels, the balance sheet is the obvious place to start. But ultimately the future profitability of the business will decide if Apple can strengthen its balance sheet over time. So if you want to see what the professionals think, you might find this free report on analyst profit forecasts to be interesting.

Finally, a business needs free cash flow to pay off debt; accounting profits just don't cut it. So we clearly need to look at whether that EBIT is leading to corresponding free cash flow. During the last three years, Apple generated free cash flow amounting to a very robust 90% of its EBIT, more than we'd expect. That positions it well to pay down debt if desirable to do so.

Our View

Apple's interest cover suggests it can handle its debt as easily as Cristiano Ronaldo could score a goal against an under 14's goalkeeper. And that's just the beginning of the good news since its conversion of EBIT to free cash flow is also very heartening. Zooming out, Apple seems to use debt quite reasonably; and that gets the nod from us. After all, sensible leverage can boost returns on equity. When analysing debt levels, the balance sheet is the obvious place to start. But ultimately, every company can contain risks that exist outside of the balance sheet. Be aware that  Apple is showing  2 warning signs in our investment analysis, you should know about...

At the end of the day, it's often better to focus on companies that are free from net debt. You can access our special list of such companies (all with a track record of profit growth). It's free.

Have feedback on this article? Concerned about the content?Get in touch with us directly. Alternatively, email editorial-team (at) simplywallst.com.

This article by Simply Wall St is general in nature. We provide commentary based on historical data and analyst forecasts only using an unbiased methodology and our articles are not intended to be financial advice. It does not constitute a recommendation to buy or sell any stock, and does not take account of your objectives, or your financial situation. We aim to bring you long-term focused analysis driven by fundamental data. Note that our analysis may not factor in the latest price-sensitive company announcements or qualitative material. Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned.

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.75, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.25, Reasoning: The analysis indicates that Apple Inc. (AAPL) is managing its debt levels conservatively while showing strong cash flow and profitability. The company's low net debt to EBITDA ratio, high interest coverage, and the fact that it generates robust free cash flow further signal financial stability. Given these factors, the overall sentiment towards the company's debt management is positive, suggesting that the likelihood of the stock price rising is higher. However, potential warning signs noted might introduce some caution among investors. Despite this, the positive financial indicators outweigh the risks, leading to a higher probability of price increase compared to a price fall.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The headline 'Why Apple Stock Could Get Hammered This Year' is explicitly negative. Without knowing the specific reasons detailed in the article's content (which is missing), it's impossible to make a definitive prediction. However, the language suggests a higher likelihood of a stock price decrease than increase. I'm assuming the article contains arguments supporting this claim.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.1, Reasoning: The news article focuses on Apple's prudent use of debt, highlighting its low net debt-to-EBITDA ratio and high interest coverage.  The analysis concludes that Apple's debt levels are manageable and pose minimal risk. This positive assessment of Apple's financial health is unlikely to cause a significant stock price drop. While the positive news might cause a slight price increase, the impact is likely to be relatively small compared to other market factors influencing Apple's stock price.  The article also notes that Apple has '2 warning signs' which are not detailed, this represents a potential downside that is not explicitly addressed by the article.  Therefore, the probability of a price increase is moderate, but the probability of a price fall is very low because the core message is positive.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news article primarily discusses Jim Cramer's comments on Apple Inc. (AAPL), including his defense of Apple's innovation post-Steve Jobs and broader market commentary. While Cramer's remarks may provide some positive sentiment, the article does not contain any significant new financial data, product announcements, or earnings updates that would directly impact Apple's stock price. The market's reaction to such commentary is typically muted unless it triggers broader investor sentiment shifts. Given the lack of concrete catalysts in the news, the probabilities of a significant price movement in either direction are low.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news headline 'Why Apple Stock Could Get Hammered This Year' suggests a negative outlook for Apple's stock performance in the current year. The use of the word 'hammered' implies a significant potential decline in stock price. This kind of headline typically influences investor sentiment negatively, potentially leading to a decrease in stock price as investors may sell their holdings in anticipation of poor performance. Therefore, based on this headline, the probability of the stock price falling appears higher than the probability of it rising.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news headline 'Why Apple Stock Could Get Hammered This Year' suggests a negative outlook for Apple's stock performance. This type of headline often indicates potential downward pressure on the stock price due to various factors that could be affecting the company, such as market trends, product performance, or economic conditions. Given the negative tone, it is reasonable to assume that the article discusses potential challenges or weaknesses that Apple might face, which could lead to a decrease in investor confidence and subsequently a fall in stock price. Therefore, the probability of the stock price falling is higher than the probability of it rising based on this news alone.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.75, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.25, Reasoning: The financial news highlights Apple's prudent and conservative approach to leveraging debt. Apple has shown a minimal net debt load, strong cash reserves, and robust EBIT margins, which indicate a company in a strong financial position. These factors suggest that the company can comfortably manage its debt burden, leading to reduced financial risks and improved investor confidence.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news highlights Apple's conservative use of debt and strong financial metrics, including a low net debt to EBITDA ratio and substantial interest coverage. The company's ability to generate robust free cash flow further supports the positive outlook on its financial health. Despite noting two warning signs, the overall sentiment regarding Apple's debt management is favorable. This promotes investor confidence, likely leading to an increased probability of stock price rise. However, the previous mixed predictions from others, especially those suggesting a more cautious outlook, introduce some uncertainty. Therefore, my estimation considers both the positive indicators and potential investor caution.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news headline is strongly negative: "Why Apple Stock Could Get Hammered This Year." This implies a high likelihood of negative news within the article, which would typically lead to a drop in stock price. However, the previous predictions by other models are diverse. Some models heavily weight the negative headline (giving high probabilities to stock price falling) while others focused on potential positive information within the *contents* of articles they claimed to analyze, assigning higher probabilities to price increases. Given that the article content is unavailable to me outside of its title, and considering the strongly negative wording of the headline, I'm giving a higher probability to a stock price fall, but slightly less extreme given the contradictory opinions in round 0.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news article focuses on Apple's conservative debt management, highlighting its low net debt, strong cash reserves, high interest coverage, and robust free cash flow.  This positive financial picture suggests a low risk of financial distress and should, in theory, be viewed favorably by investors.  While the article mentions two unspecified warning signs, the overwhelming emphasis is on the positive aspects of Apple's financial health.  Many previous models provided varied probabilities, some based on additional negative news not included in this article.  Considering the exclusively positive financial information provided, the probability of a price rise is higher than the probability of a price fall. However, it's crucial to acknowledge that stock prices are affected by numerous factors beyond a single news article, including overall market sentiment, broader economic conditions, and any unforeseen events. Therefore, the probabilities are not skewed strongly towards one side, since the article doesn't contain a major event and the positive aspects are not overwhelmingly significant in comparison to the potential unspecified warning signs.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article primarily discusses Jim Cramer's comments on Apple Inc. (AAPL), including his defense of Apple's innovation post-Steve Jobs and broader market commentary. While Cramer's remarks may provide some positive sentiment, the article does not contain any significant new financial data, product announcements, or earnings updates that would directly impact Apple's stock price. The market's reaction to such commentary is typically muted unless it triggers broader investor sentiment shifts. Given the lack of concrete catalysts in the news, the probabilities of a significant price movement in either direction are low. However, considering the mixed performance of Apple's stock in 2025 and the ongoing concerns about innovation and iPhone sales, the sentiment leans slightly negative.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news headline 'Why Apple Stock Could Get Hammered This Year' has a negative tone, suggesting potential downward pressure on Apple's stock price. However, the previous predictions from various models provide mixed sentiments. Some models focus on Apple's financial health, noting its conservative debt management, strong cash flow, and profitability, which suggest a positive outlook. Others emphasize the negative tone of the headline, assigning a higher probability to a stock price decrease. Considering the mixed financial indicators and the explicitly negative headline, it's reasonable to assume that the stock price has a higher chance of falling than rising. However, the presence of positive financial indicators prevents a unanimous prediction of a significant decline.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.42, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.58, Reasoning: The news headline 'Why Apple Stock Could Get Hammered This Year' suggests a negative outlook for Apple's stock performance. However, considering the previous predictions and the fact that some models have assigned a higher probability to the stock price rising due to Apple's prudent debt management and strong financial indicators, it's essential to balance the negative sentiment with the company's fundamental strengths. The predictions from other models indicate a wide range of beliefs, from a higher likelihood of the stock price falling to a moderate probability of it rising. Given the explicit negative tone of the headline but also considering the potential for the company's financial health to mitigate negative impacts, I estimate the probability of the stock price falling to be slightly higher than the probability of it rising.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Parse error
Round: 2
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The analysis of Apple's financial health reveals that the company employs a conservative approach to debt management, showcasing strong financial metrics such as a low net debt to EBITDA ratio and very high interest coverage. This suggests that Apple is in a robust position to handle its debt obligations and generates significant free cash flow, which further mitigates risks related to its liabilities. While the article does mention some warning signs that may create caution among investors, the overall sentiment regarding Apple's financial management is positive. This leads to an implied higher likelihood of stock price appreciation. The recent mixed predictions from other models present a range of outcomes, but the overall financial stability and prudent risk management from Apple suggest a stronger probability of price increase compared to decline.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.38, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.62, Reasoning: The news headline is negative, suggesting a potential decline in Apple's stock price. However, several models in the previous rounds analyzed content seemingly different than what the headline indicates (focusing on debt management and financial health), leading to mixed predictions. While the headline is overtly negative, the varied responses in previous rounds, some emphasizing positive financial indicators, introduce uncertainty. I slightly increase the probability of a price fall given the headline, but temper it due to the diverse opinions of other models and the possibility of mitigating factors within the article content.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news article focuses on Apple's conservative debt management, highlighting its strong financial position.  Key positive indicators include a low net debt-to-EBITDA ratio, high interest coverage, and robust free cash flow generation. This suggests a low risk of financial distress and should be viewed favorably by investors. However, the article mentions two unspecified 'warning signs', which introduces uncertainty.  The previous predictions show considerable divergence, some focusing heavily on the potentially negative implications of an unspecified headline (which is not included in this article directly, the headline is only given in the context of multiple previous rounds), others emphasizing Apple's sound financial health. Considering the predominantly positive financial data presented in this particular news piece, the probability of a price rise is higher than a price fall. However, the unspecified warning signs and the overall market volatility prevent a strong positive prediction.  The range of previous predictions emphasizes that other factors outside this news piece are also influencing market sentiment towards AAPL.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article primarily discusses Jim Cramer's comments on Apple Inc. (AAPL), including his defense of Apple's innovation post-Steve Jobs and broader market commentary. While Cramer's remarks may provide some positive sentiment, the article does not contain any significant new financial data, product announcements, or earnings updates that would directly impact Apple's stock price. The market's reaction to such commentary is typically muted unless it triggers broader investor sentiment shifts. Given the lack of concrete catalysts in the news, the probabilities of a significant price movement in either direction are low. However, considering the mixed performance of Apple's stock in 2025 and the ongoing concerns about innovation and iPhone sales, the sentiment leans slightly negative.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Parse error
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.42, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.58, Reasoning: The analysis of the news headline 'Why Apple Stock Could Get Hammered This Year' suggests a negative outlook for Apple's stock performance. However, considering the previous predictions from various models, which provide mixed sentiments regarding Apple's financial health and the impact of the headline, it's essential to balance the negative sentiment with the company's fundamental strengths. Some models focus on Apple's conservative debt management, strong cash flow, and profitability, suggesting a positive outlook, while others emphasize the negative tone of the headline, assigning a higher probability to a stock price decrease. Given the explicit negative tone of the headline but also considering the potential for the company's financial health to mitigate negative impacts, the estimated probabilities reflect a cautious approach, acknowledging both the positive financial indicators and the potential downward pressure indicated by the headline.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The financial news highlights Apple's prudent and conservative approach to leveraging debt, coupled with strong cash reserves and robust free cash flow, which contributes to a favorable financial health outlook. Most recent predictions show a mixed sentiment with a slight bias toward caution. While some predict a higher probability of the stock price rising due to positive financial metrics, others emphasize the negative headline and potential warning signs. Considering the overall positive financial picture and the fact that Apple has manageable debt and strong cash flow, along with the mix of sentiments expressed in the previous rounds, the probability of the stock price rising may be moderately higher. However, the caution indicated by previous predictions suggests a balanced outlook.
Round: 3
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The analysis of Apple's financial condition reveals a conservative approach to debt management, with a low net debt to EBITDA ratio and significant interest coverage. Apple's ability to generate robust free cash flow further supports its capability to handle its debt obligations confidently. Although the article mentions two unspecified warning signs, the overall sentiment surrounding Apple's financial stability remains positive. Previous predictions reflected a mix of optimism and caution, but the strong fundamentals in the context of its debt management suggest a higher probability of stock price increase. Thus, the expected probability of the stock price rising is greater than that of it falling.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The overarching narrative presents a conflict: a negative headline ('Why Apple Stock Could Get Hammered This Year') versus analyses focusing on Apple's sound financial metrics (conservative debt management, high cash flow). Previous rounds show a divergence in predictions, some weighted heavily on the headline, others on financial strength, and some attempting to balance both. In rounds where the article was claimed to focus on financial factors, predictions skewed positive. Where just the sentiment of the headline was considered, predictions were negative. Many models noted 'warning signs' that tempered their predictions, along with the state of 2025 performance and innovation concerns. Given the ambiguity (positive financials vs. negative headline and vague concerns) and the variability of interpretations in previous rounds, I'll adjust slightly toward the negative headline's influence but not overwhelmingly. The headline is a powerful signal, but the persistent evidence of strong financials is also relevant. I predict a slightly higher probability of the stock price falling but still acknowledge the underlying strength.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article focuses on Apple's conservative debt management, highlighting its strong financial position with a low net debt-to-EBITDA ratio, high interest coverage, and robust free cash flow. This positive financial picture suggests a low risk of financial distress and should be viewed favorably by investors.  However, the article mentions two unspecified 'warning signs', which introduces a degree of uncertainty.  The previous predictions from various models show significant divergence, reflecting the influence of factors beyond this specific news item, including market sentiment and other information not available in this context.  The headline used in previous rounds ('Why Apple Stock Could Get Hammered This Year') is strongly negative, and while not directly included here, its consistent appearance in previous prediction rounds suggests the possibility of prevailing bearish sentiment influencing the overall outlook. Considering the predominantly positive financial data presented in this news piece, I've assigned a higher probability to a price rise than a price fall. However, the unspecified warning signs, the negative headline mentioned in previous rounds, and the overall market volatility prevent a strong positive prediction.  The probabilities are adjusted to reflect the balance between the positive financial news and the lingering uncertainty.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article discusses Jim Cramer's comments on Apple Inc. (AAPL), including his defense of Apple's innovation post-Steve Jobs and broader market commentary. While Cramer's remarks may provide some positive sentiment, the article does not contain any significant new financial data, product announcements, or earnings updates that would directly impact Apple's stock price. The market's reaction to such commentary is typically muted unless it triggers broader investor sentiment shifts. Given the lack of concrete catalysts in the news, the probabilities of a significant price movement in either direction are low. However, considering the mixed performance of Apple's stock in 2025 and the ongoing concerns about innovation and iPhone sales, the sentiment leans slightly negative. Previous predictions from other models also show a mixed sentiment, with some focusing on Apple's strong financial health and others emphasizing the negative tone of the headline. Balancing these factors, the probability of the stock price falling is slightly higher than the probability of it rising.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news headline 'Why Apple Stock Could Get Hammered This Year' suggests a negative outlook for Apple's stock performance. However, analyzing the previous predictions and the general sentiment around Apple's financial health, it appears that the company's conservative debt management, strong cash flow, and profitability contribute to a mixed outlook. While the headline indicates potential risks, Apple's financial indicators, such as its low net debt to EBITDA ratio and high interest coverage, suggest a positive assessment of its financial stability. Considering these factors, the estimated probability of the stock price rising is higher than the probability of it falling, but the negative tone of the headline cannot be ignored.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.48, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.52, Reasoning: The analysis of the financial news and previous predictions suggests a mixed sentiment towards Apple's stock performance. The news headline 'Why Apple Stock Could Get Hammered This Year' implies a negative outlook, but the content of the news article, as analyzed by some models, highlights Apple's conservative debt management, strong cash flow, and profitability. Considering the diverse opinions and the company's fundamental strengths, the estimated probabilities reflect a cautious approach. The overall positive financial picture and manageable debt suggest a moderate probability of the stock price rising, while the negative headline and potential warning signs indicate a slightly higher probability of the stock price falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The financial news highlights Apple's prudent and conservative approach to leveraging debt, coupled with strong cash reserves and robust free cash flow, which contributes to a favorable financial health outlook. Most recent predictions show a mixed sentiment with a slight bias toward caution. While some predict a higher probability of the stock price rising due to positive financial metrics, others emphasize the negative headline and potential warning signs. Considering the overall positive financial picture and the fact that Apple has manageable debt and strong cash flow, along with the mix of sentiments expressed in the previous rounds, the probability of the stock price rising may be moderately higher. However, the caution indicated by previous predictions suggests a balanced outlook.
